intro: Anneslia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas anneslia, is a flowering plant native to Central America, specifically found in the highlands of Chiapas, Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Anneslia chiapensis is a perennial herb that produces small, greenish leaves and is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
